intro: Aegiphila mortonii, commonly known as the Morton's aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are often aromatic and have a slightly minty scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
